member.name: T:VscAppz.Vsc
member.summary: Everything related to the running of your app.

member.name: F:VscAppz.Vsc.OnErrorDefaultOutputFormat
member.summary: Used by the default `OnError` handler to print error details to stderr (aka. `Console.Error`).

member.name: F:VscAppz.Vsc.OnError
member.summary:
Reports problems during the ongoing forever-looping stdin/stdout communication with the `vscode-appz` VSC extension. Defaults to a stderr println. Must not be `null`. Any of its args must be checked for `null`-ness by the `OnError` handler.
`IVscode self`── the caller that encountered the problem being reported.
`object err` ── if an `Exception`, it occurred on the C# side (I/O or JSON), else some JSON-decoded C# value from whatever was transmitted as the problem data (if anything) by VS Code.
`object jsonMsg` ─ if a `string`, the incoming JSON message; if a `Dictionary<string, object>`, the outgoing one.

member.name: M:VscAppz.Vsc.Main(System.Action{VscAppz.IVscode},System.IO.TextReader,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Creates an `IVscode` implementation that communicates via the specified input and output streams (with `stdIn` defaulting to `Console.In` and `stdOut` defaulting to `Console.Out`), then loops forever to never `return`.
member.param: Called whenever the counterparty demands, which usually means once at startup.
If `null`, defaults to `Console.In`.
If `null`, defaults to `Console.Out`

member.name: T:VscAppz.Cancel
member.summary: Allows belated cancellation of ongoing / already-initiated interactions.

member.name: M:VscAppz.Cancel.Now
member.summary: Cancel.Now signals cancellation to the counterparty.

member.name: M:VscAppz.Cancel.In(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Cancel.In returns a new `Cancel` with its `Now` already scheduled to be called in `fromNow` duration.

member.name: T:VscAppz.Disposable
member.summary: Disposable represents an non-transient object identity lifetimed at the counterparty.

member.name: M:VscAppz.Disposable.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose signals to the counterparty to destroy the object.

member.name: T:VscAppz.StatusBarAlignment
member.summary: Represents the alignment of status bar items.

member.name: F:VscAppz.StatusBarAlignment.Left
member.summary: Aligned to the left side.

member.name: F:VscAppz.StatusBarAlignment.Right

member.name: T:VscAppz.IVscode
member.summary: Type Definition for Visual Studio Code 1.38 Extension API See https://code.visualstudio.com/api for more information

member.name: P:VscAppz.IVscode.Window
member.summary: Namespace for dealing with the current window of the editor. That is visible and active editors, as well as, UI elements to show messages, selections, and asking for user input.

member.name: P:VscAppz.IVscode.Env
member.summary: Namespace describing the environment the editor runs in.

member.name: P:VscAppz.IVscode.Workspace
member.summary:
Namespace for dealing with the current workspace. A workspace is the representation of the folder that has been opened. There is no workspace when just a file but not a folder has been opened.
The workspace offers support for [listening](#workspace.createFileSystemWatcher) to fs events and for [finding](#workspace.findFiles) files. Both perform well and run _outside_ the editor-process so that they should be always used instead of nodejs-equivalents.

member.name: P:VscAppz.IVscode.Languages
member.summary:
Namespace for participating in language-specific editor [features](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/editingevolved), like IntelliSense, code actions, diagnostics etc.
Many programming languages exist and there is huge variety in syntaxes, semantics, and paradigms. Despite that, features like automatic word-completion, code navigation, or code checking have become popular across different tools for different programming languages.
The editor provides an API that makes it simple to provide such common features by having all UI and actions already in place and by allowing you to participate by providing data only. For instance, to contribute a hover all you have to do is provide a function that can be called with a [TextDocument](#TextDocument) and a [Position](#Position) returning hover info. The rest, like tracking the mouse, positioning the hover, keeping the hover stable etc. is taken care of by the editor.
```javascript languages.registerHoverProvider('javascript', { provideHover(document, position, token) { return new Hover('I am a hover!'); } }); ```
Registration is done using a [document selector](#DocumentSelector) which is either a language id, like `javascript` or a more complex [filter](#DocumentFilter) like `{ language: 'typescript', scheme: 'file' }`. Matching a document against such a selector will result in a [score](#languages.match) that is used to determine if and how a provider shall be used. When scores are equal the provider that came last wins. For features that allow full arity, like [hover](#languages.registerHoverProvider), the score is only checked to be `>0`, for other features, like [IntelliSense](#languages.registerCompletionItemProvider) the score is used for determining the order in which providers are asked to participate.

member.name: P:VscAppz.IVscode.Extensions

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWindow.ShowInformationMessage1(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary:
Show an information message to users. Optionally provide an array of items which will be presented as clickable buttons.
`message` ── The message to show.
`items` ── A set of items that will be rendered as actions in the message.
`return` ── A thenable that resolves to the selected item or `undefined` when being dismissed.
member.param: The message to show.
A set of items that will be rendered as actions in the message.
member.return: A thenable that resolves to the selected item or `undefined` when being dismissed.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWindow.ShowInputBox(VscAppz.InputBoxOptions,VscAppz.Cancel)
member.summary:
Opens an input box to ask the user for input.
The returned value will be `undefined` if the input box was canceled (e.g. pressing ESC). Otherwise the returned value will be the string typed by the user or an empty string if the user did not type anything but dismissed the input box with OK.
`options` ── Configures the behavior of the input box.
`token` ── A token that can be used to signal cancellation.
`return` ── A promise that resolves to a string the user provided or to `undefined` in case of dismissal.
member.param: Configures the behavior of the input box.
A token that can be used to signal cancellation.
member.return: A promise that resolves to a string the user provided or to `undefined` in case of dismissal.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWindow.SetStatusBarMessage1(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set a message to the status bar. This is a short hand for the more powerful status bar [items](#window.createStatusBarItem).
`text` ── The message to show, supports icon substitution as in status bar [items](#StatusBarItem.text).
`hideAfterTimeout` ── Timeout in milliseconds after which the message will be disposed.
`return` ── A disposable which hides the status bar message.
member.param: The message to show, supports icon substitution as in status bar [items](#StatusBarItem.text).
Timeout in milliseconds after which the message will be disposed.
member.return: A disposable which hides the status bar message.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWindow.SetStatusBarMessage2(System.String)
member.summary:
Set a message to the status bar. This is a short hand for the more powerful status bar [items](#window.createStatusBarItem).
*Note* that status bar messages stack and that they must be disposed when no longer used.
`text` ── The message to show, supports icon substitution as in status bar [items](#StatusBarItem.text).
`return` ── A disposable which hides the status bar message.
member.param: The message to show, supports icon substitution as in status bar [items](#StatusBarItem.text).
member.return: A disposable which hides the status bar message.

member.name: T:VscAppz.IEnv
member.summary: Namespace describing the environment the editor runs in.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IEnv.OpenExternal(System.String)
member.summary:
Opens an *external* item, e.g. a http(s) or mailto-link, using the default application.
*Note* that [`showTextDocument`](#window.showTextDocument) is the right way to open a text document inside the editor, not this function.
`target` ── The uri that should be opened.
`return` ── A promise indicating if open was successful.
member.param: The uri that should be opened.
member.return: A promise indicating if open was successful.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IEnv.AppName
member.summary: The application name of the editor, like 'VS Code'.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IEnv.AppRoot
member.summary: The application root folder from which the editor is running.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IEnv.Language
member.summary: Represents the preferred user-language, like `de-CH`, `fr`, or `en-US`.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IEnv.MachineId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the computer.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IEnv.RemoteName
member.summary:
The name of a remote. Defined by extensions, popular samples are `wsl` for the Windows Subsystem for Linux or `ssh-remote` for remotes using a secure shell.
*Note* that the value is `undefined` when there is no remote extension host but that the value is defined in all extension hosts (local and remote) in case a remote extension host exists. Use [`Extension#extensionKind`](#Extension.extensionKind) to know if a specific extension runs remote or not.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IEnv.SessionId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the current session. Changes each time the editor is started.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IEnv.Shell
member.summary: The detected default shell for the extension host, this is overridden by the `terminal.integrated.shell` setting for the extension host's platform.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IEnv.UriScheme
member.summary: The custom uri scheme the editor registers to in the operating system.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IEnv.Properties
member.summary: Provides single-call access to numerous individual `IEnv` properties at once.

member.name: T:VscAppz.IWorkspace
member.summary:
Namespace for dealing with the current workspace. A workspace is the representation of the folder that has been opened. There is no workspace when just a file but not a folder has been opened.
The workspace offers support for [listening](#workspace.createFileSystemWatcher) to fs events and for [finding](#workspace.findFiles) files. Both perform well and run _outside_ the editor-process so that they should be always used instead of nodejs-equivalents.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWorkspace.Name
member.summary: The name of the workspace. `undefined` when no folder has been opened.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWorkspace.WorkspaceFile
member.summary:
The location of the workspace file, for example:
`file:///Users/name/Development/myProject.code-workspace`
or
`untitled:1555503116870`
for a workspace that is untitled and not yet saved.
Depending on the workspace that is opened, the value will be: * `undefined` when no workspace or a single folder is opened * the path of the workspace file as `Uri` otherwise. if the workspace is untitled, the returned URI will use the `untitled:` scheme
The location can e.g. be used with the `vscode.openFolder` command to open the workspace again after it has been closed.
**Example:** ```typescript vscode.commands.executeCommand('vscode.openFolder', uriOfWorkspace); ```
**Note:** it is not advised to use `workspace.workspaceFile` to write configuration data into the file. You can use `workspace.getConfiguration().update()` for that purpose which will work both when a single folder is opened as well as an untitled or saved workspace.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWorkspace.SaveAll(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Save all dirty files.
`includeUntitled` ── Also save files that have been created during this session.
`return` ── A thenable that resolves when the files have been saved.
member.param: Also save files that have been created during this session.
member.return: A thenable that resolves when the files have been saved.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWorkspace.OnDidChangeWorkspaceFolders(System.Action{VscAppz.WorkspaceFoldersChangeEvent})
member.summary: An event that is emitted when a workspace folder is added or removed.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWorkspace.GetWorkspaceFolder(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns the [workspace folder](#WorkspaceFolder) that contains a given uri. * returns `undefined` when the given uri doesn't match any workspace folder * returns the *input* when the given uri is a workspace folder itself
`uri` ── An uri.
`return` ── A workspace folder or `undefined`
member.param: An uri.
member.return: A workspace folder or `undefined`

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWorkspace.WorkspaceFolders
member.summary: List of workspace folders or `undefined` when no folder is open. *Note* that the first entry corresponds to the value of `rootPath`.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWorkspace.FindFiles(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},VscAppz.Cancel)
member.summary:
Find files across all [workspace folders](#workspace.workspaceFolders) in the workspace. `findFiles('**​/*.js', '**​/node_modules/**', 10)`
`include` ── A [glob pattern](#GlobPattern) that defines the files to search for. The glob pattern will be matched against the file paths of resulting matches relative to their workspace. Use a [relative pattern](#RelativePattern) to restrict the search results to a [workspace folder](#WorkspaceFolder).
`exclude` ── A [glob pattern](#GlobPattern) that defines files and folders to exclude. The glob pattern will be matched against the file paths of resulting matches relative to their workspace. When `undefined` only default excludes will apply, when `null` no excludes will apply.
`maxResults` ── An upper-bound for the result.
`token` ── A token that can be used to signal cancellation to the underlying search engine.
`return` ── A thenable that resolves to an array of resource identifiers. Will return no results if no [workspace folders](#workspace.workspaceFolders) are opened.
member.param: A [glob pattern](#GlobPattern) that defines the files to search for. The glob pattern will be matched against the file paths of resulting matches relative to their workspace. Use a [relative pattern](#RelativePattern) to restrict the search results to a [workspace folder](#WorkspaceFolder).

A [glob pattern](#GlobPattern) that defines files and folders to exclude. The glob pattern will be matched against the file paths of resulting matches relative to their workspace. When `undefined` only default excludes will apply, when `null` no excludes will apply.
An upper-bound for the result.
A token that can be used to signal cancellation to the underlying search engine.
member.return: A thenable that resolves to an array of resource identifiers. Will return no results if no [workspace folders](#workspace.workspaceFolders) are opened.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWorkspace.AsRelativePath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Returns a path that is relative to the workspace folder or folders.
When there are no [workspace folders](#workspace.workspaceFolders) or when the path is not contained in them, the input is returned.
`pathOrUri` ── A path or uri. When a uri is given its [fsPath](#Uri.fsPath) is used.
`includeWorkspaceFolder` ── When `true` and when the given path is contained inside a workspace folder the name of the workspace is prepended. Defaults to `true` when there are multiple workspace folders and `false` otherwise.
`return` ── A path relative to the root or the input.
member.param: A path or uri. When a uri is given its [fsPath](#Uri.fsPath) is used.
When `true` and when the given path is contained inside a workspace folder the name of the workspace is prepended. Defaults to `true` when there are multiple workspace folders and `false` otherwise.
member.return: A path relative to the root or the input.

member.name: M:VscAppz.IWorkspace.Properties
member.summary: Provides single-call access to numerous individual `IWorkspace` properties at once.

member.name: T:VscAppz.ILanguages
member.summary:
Namespace for participating in language-specific editor [features](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/editingevolved), like IntelliSense, code actions, diagnostics etc.
Many programming languages exist and there is huge variety in syntaxes, semantics, and paradigms. Despite that, features like automatic word-completion, code navigation, or code checking have become popular across different tools for different programming languages.
The editor provides an API that makes it simple to provide such common features by having all UI and actions already in place and by allowing you to participate by providing data only. For instance, to contribute a hover all you have to do is provide a function that can be called with a [TextDocument](#TextDocument) and a [Position](#Position) returning hover info. The rest, like tracking the mouse, positioning the hover, keeping the hover stable etc. is taken care of by the editor.
```javascript languages.registerHoverProvider('javascript', { provideHover(document, position, token) { return new Hover('I am a hover!'); } }); ```
Registration is done using a [document selector](#DocumentSelector) which is either a language id, like `javascript` or a more complex [filter](#DocumentFilter) like `{ language: 'typescript', scheme: 'file' }`. Matching a document against such a selector will result in a [score](#languages.match) that is used to determine if and how a provider shall be used. When scores are equal the provider that came last wins. For features that allow full arity, like [hover](#languages.registerHoverProvider), the score is only checked to be `>0`, for other features, like [IntelliSense](#languages.registerCompletionItemProvider) the score is used for determining the order in which providers are asked to participate.

member.name: M:VscAppz.ILanguages.GetLanguages
member.summary:
Return the identifiers of all known languages.
`return` ── Promise resolving to an array of identifier strings.
member.return: Promise resolving to an array of identifier strings.

member.name: M:VscAppz.ILanguages.OnDidChangeDiagnostics(System.Action{VscAppz.DiagnosticChangeEvent})
member.summary: An [event](#Event) which fires when the global set of diagnostics changes. This is newly added and removed diagnostics.

member.name: T:VscAppz.IExtensions
M:VscAppz.IExtensions.OnDidChange(System.Action)
member.summary: An event which fires when `extensions.all` changes. This can happen when extensions are installed, uninstalled, enabled or disabled.

member.name: T:VscAppz.ICommands
M:VscAppz.ICommands.RegisterCommand(System.String,System.Func{System.Object[],System.Object})
member.summary:
Registers a command that can be invoked via a keyboard shortcut, a menu item, an action, or directly.
Registering a command with an existing command identifier twice will cause an error.
`command` ── A unique identifier for the command.
`callback` ── A command handler function.
`return` ── Disposable which unregisters this command on disposal.
member.param: A unique identifier for the command.
A command handler function.
member.return: Disposable which unregisters this command on disposal.

member.name: M:VscAppz.ICommands.ExecuteCommand(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Executes the command denoted by the given command identifier.
* *Note 1:* When executing an editor command not all types are allowed to be passed as arguments. Allowed are the primitive types `string`, `boolean`, `number`, `undefined`, and `null`, as well as [`Position`](#Position), [`Range`](#Range), [`Uri`](#Uri) and [`Location`](#Location). * *Note 2:* There are no restrictions when executing commands that have been contributed by extensions.
`command` ── Identifier of the command to execute.
`rest` ── Parameters passed to the command function.
`return` ── A thenable that resolves to the returned value of the given command. `undefined` when the command handler function doesn't return anything.
member.param: Identifier of the command to execute.
Parameters passed to the command function.
member.return: A thenable that resolves to the returned value of the given command. `undefined` when the command handler function doesn't return anything.

member.name: M:VscAppz.ICommands.GetCommands(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Retrieve the list of all available commands. Commands starting an underscore are treated as internal commands.
`filterInternal` ── Set `true` to not see internal commands (starting with an underscore)
`return` ── Thenable that resolves to a list of command ids.
member.param: Set `true` to not see internal commands (starting with an underscore)
member.return: Thenable that resolves to a list of command ids.

member.name: T:VscAppz.MessageOptions
member.summary: Options to configure the behavior of the message.

member.name: F:VscAppz.MessageOptions.Modal
member.summary: Indicates that this message should be modal.

member.name: T:VscAppz.MessageItem
member.summary: Represents an action that is shown with an information, warning, or error message.

member.name: F:VscAppz.MessageItem.Title
member.summary: A short title like 'Retry', 'Open Log' etc.

member.name: F:VscAppz.MessageItem.IsCloseAffordance
member.summary:
A hint for modal dialogs that the item should be triggered when the user cancels the dialog (e.g. by pressing the ESC key).
Note: this option is ignored for non-modal messages.

member.name: F:VscAppz.MessageItem.My
member.summary: Free-form custom data, preserved across a roundtrip.

member.name: T:VscAppz.InputBoxOptions
member.summary: Options to configure the behavior of the input box UI.

member.name: F:VscAppz.InputBoxOptions.Value
member.summary: The value to prefill in the input box.

member.name: F:VscAppz.InputBoxOptions.ValueSelection
member.summary: Selection of the prefilled [`value`](#InputBoxOptions.value). Defined as tuple of two number where the first is the inclusive start index and the second the exclusive end index. When `undefined` the whole word will be selected, when empty (start equals end) only the cursor will be set, otherwise the defined range will be selected.

member.name: F:VscAppz.InputBoxOptions.Prompt
member.summary: The text to display underneath the input box.

member.name: F:VscAppz.InputBoxOptions.PlaceHolder
member.summary: An optional string to show as place holder in the input box to guide the user what to type.

member.name: F:VscAppz.InputBoxOptions.Password
member.summary: Set to `true` to show a password prompt that will not show the typed value.

member.name: F:VscAppz.InputBoxOptions.IgnoreFocusOut
member.summary: Set to `true` to keep the input box open when focus moves to another part of the editor or to another window.

member.name: F:VscAppz.InputBoxOptions.ValidateInput
member.summary:
An optional function that will be called to validate input and to give a hint to the user.
`value` ── The current value of the input box.
`return` ── A human readable string which is presented as diagnostic message. Return `undefined`, `null`, or the empty string when 'value' is valid.

member.name: F:VscAppz.InputBoxOptions.ValidateInput_AppzFuncId
member.summary: For internal runtime use only.

member.name: T:VscAppz.SaveDialogOptions
member.summary: Options to configure the behaviour of a file save dialog.

member.name: F:VscAppz.SaveDialogOptions.DefaultUri
member.summary: The resource the dialog shows when opened.

member.name: F:VscAppz.SaveDialogOptions.SaveLabel
member.summary: A human-readable string for the save button.

member.name: F:VscAppz.SaveDialogOptions.Filters
member.summary: A set of file filters that are used by the dialog. Each entry is a human readable label, like "TypeScript", and an array of extensions, e.g. ```ts { 'Images': ['png', 'jpg'] 'TypeScript': ['ts', 'tsx'] } ```

member.name: T:VscAppz.OpenDialogOptions
member.summary:
Options to configure the behaviour of a file open dialog.
* Note 1: A dialog can select files, folders, or both. This is not true for Windows which enforces to open either files or folder, but *not both*. * Note 2: Explicitly setting `canSelectFiles` and `canSelectFolders` to `false` is futile and the editor then silently adjusts the options to select files.

member.name: F:VscAppz.OpenDialogOptions.DefaultUri
member.summary: The resource the dialog shows when opened.

member.name: F:VscAppz.OpenDialogOptions.OpenLabel
member.summary: A human-readable string for the open button.

member.name: F:VscAppz.OpenDialogOptions.CanSelectFiles
member.summary: Allow to select files, defaults to `true`.

member.name: F:VscAppz.OpenDialogOptions.CanSelectFolders
member.summary: Allow to select folders, defaults to `false`.

member.name: F:VscAppz.OpenDialogOptions.CanSelectMany
member.summary: Allow to select many files or folders.

member.name: F:VscAppz.OpenDialogOptions.Filters
member.summary: A set of file filters that are used by the dialog. Each entry is a human readable label, like "TypeScript", and an array of extensions, e.g. ```ts { 'Images': ['png', 'jpg'] 'TypeScript': ['ts', 'tsx'] } ```

member.name: T:VscAppz.WorkspaceFolderPickOptions

member.name: F:VscAppz.WorkspaceFolderPickOptions.PlaceHolder
member.summary: An optional string to show as place holder in the input box to guide the user what to pick on.

member.name: F:VscAppz.WorkspaceFolderPickOptions.IgnoreFocusOut
member.summary: Set to `true` to keep the picker open when focus moves to another part of the editor or to another window.

member.name: T:VscAppz.WorkspaceFolder
member.summary: A workspace folder is one of potentially many roots opened by the editor. All workspace folders are equal which means there is no notion of an active or master workspace folder.

member.name: F:VscAppz.WorkspaceFolder.Uri
member.summary:
The associated uri for this workspace folder.
*Note:* The [Uri](#Uri)-type was intentionally chosen such that future releases of the editor can support workspace folders that are not stored on the local disk, e.g. `ftp://server/workspaces/foo`.

member.name: F:VscAppz.WorkspaceFolder.Name
member.summary: The name of this workspace folder. Defaults to the basename of its [uri-path](#Uri.path)

member.name: F:VscAppz.WorkspaceFolder.Index
member.summary: The ordinal number of this workspace folder.

member.name: F:VscAppz.WindowState.Focused
member.summary: Whether the current window is focused.

member.name: M:VscAppz.StatusBarItem.Hide
member.summary: Hide the entry in the status bar.

member.name: T:VscAppz.OutputChannel
member.summary:
An output channel is a container for readonly textual information.
To get an instance of an `OutputChannel` use [createOutputChannel](#window.createOutputChannel).

member.summary:
Append the given value to the channel.
`value` ── A string, falsy values will not be printed.
member.param: A string, falsy values will not be printed.

member.summary:
Append the given value and a line feed character to the channel.
`value` ── A string, falsy values will be printed.
member.param: A string, falsy values will be printed.

member.name: M:VscAppz.OutputChannel.Clear
member.summary: Removes all output from the channel.

Reveal this channel in the UI.
`preserveFocus` ── When `true` the channel will not take focus.
member.param: When `true` the channel will not take focus.

member.name: M:VscAppz.OutputChannel.Hide
member.summary: Hide this channel from the UI.

member.name: M:VscAppz.OutputChannel.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose and free associated resources.

member.name: M:VscAppz.OutputChannel.Get

member.name: T:VscAppz.WorkspaceFoldersChangeEvent
member.summary: An event describing a change to the set of [workspace folders](#workspace.workspaceFolders).

member.name: F:VscAppz.WorkspaceFoldersChangeEvent.Added
member.summary: Added workspace folders.

member.name: F:VscAppz.WorkspaceFoldersChangeEvent.Removed
member.summary: Removed workspace folders.

member.name: T:VscAppz.DiagnosticChangeEvent
member.summary: The event that is fired when diagnostics change.

member.name: F:VscAppz.DiagnosticChangeEvent.Uris

member.name: T:VscAppz.EnvProperties
member.summary: Namespace describing the environment the editor runs in.

member.name: F:VscAppz.EnvProperties.AppName
member.summary: The application name of the editor, like 'VS Code'.

member.name: F:VscAppz.EnvProperties.AppRoot
member.summary: The application root folder from which the editor is running.

member.name: F:VscAppz.EnvProperties.Language
member.summary: Represents the preferred user-language, like `de-CH`, `fr`, or `en-US`.

member.name: F:VscAppz.EnvProperties.MachineId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the computer.

member.name: F:VscAppz.EnvProperties.RemoteName
member.summary:
The name of a remote. Defined by extensions, popular samples are `wsl` for the Windows Subsystem for Linux or `ssh-remote` for remotes using a secure shell.
*Note* that the value is `undefined` when there is no remote extension host but that the value is defined in all extension hosts (local and remote) in case a remote extension host exists. Use [`Extension#extensionKind`](#Extension.extensionKind) to know if a specific extension runs remote or not.

member.name: F:VscAppz.EnvProperties.SessionId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the current session. Changes each time the editor is started.

member.name: F:VscAppz.EnvProperties.Shell
member.summary: The detected default shell for the extension host, this is overridden by the `terminal.integrated.shell` setting for the extension host's platform.

member.name: F:VscAppz.EnvProperties.UriScheme
member.summary: The custom uri scheme the editor registers to in the operating system.

member.name: T:VscAppz.WorkspaceProperties
member.summary:
Namespace for dealing with the current workspace. A workspace is the representation of the folder that has been opened. There is no workspace when just a file but not a folder has been opened.
The workspace offers support for [listening](#workspace.createFileSystemWatcher) to fs events and for [finding](#workspace.findFiles) files. Both perform well and run _outside_ the editor-process so that they should be always used instead of nodejs-equivalents.

member.name: F:VscAppz.WorkspaceProperties.Name
member.summary: The name of the workspace. `undefined` when no folder has been opened.

member.name: F:VscAppz.WorkspaceProperties.WorkspaceFile
member.summary:
The location of the workspace file, for example:
`file:///Users/name/Development/myProject.code-workspace`
or
`untitled:1555503116870`
for a workspace that is untitled and not yet saved.
Depending on the workspace that is opened, the value will be: * `undefined` when no workspace or a single folder is opened * the path of the workspace file as `Uri` otherwise. if the workspace is untitled, the returned URI will use the `untitled:` scheme
The location can e.g. be used with the `vscode.openFolder` command to open the workspace again after it has been closed.
**Example:** ```typescript vscode.commands.executeCommand('vscode.openFolder', uriOfWorkspace); ```
**Note:** it is not advised to use `workspace.workspaceFile` to write configuration data into the file. You can use `workspace.getConfiguration().update()` for that purpose which will work both when a single folder is opened as well as an untitled or saved workspace.

member.name: F:VscAppz.WorkspaceProperties.WorkspaceFolders
member.summary: List of workspace folders or `undefined` when no folder is open. *Note* that the first entry corresponds to the value of `rootPath`.

member.name: T:VscAppz.StatusBarItemProperties
member.summary: A status bar item is a status bar contribution that can show text and icons and run a command on click.

member.name: F:VscAppz.StatusBarItemProperties.Alignment
member.summary: The alignment of this item.

member.name: F:VscAppz.StatusBarItemProperties.Priority
member.summary: The priority of this item. Higher value means the item should be shown more to the left.

member.name: F:VscAppz.StatusBarItemProperties.Text
member.summary:
The text to show for the entry. You can embed icons in the text by leveraging the syntax:
`My text $(icon-name) contains icons like $(icon-name) this one.`
Where the icon-name is taken from the [octicon](https://octicons.github.com) icon set, e.g. `light-bulb`, `thumbsup`, `zap` etc.

member.name: F:VscAppz.StatusBarItemProperties.Tooltip
member.summary: The tooltip text when you hover over this entry.

member.name: F:VscAppz.StatusBarItemProperties.Color
member.summary: The foreground color for this entry.

member.name: F:VscAppz.StatusBarItemProperties.Command
member.summary: The identifier of a command to run on click. The command must be [known](#commands.getCommands).

member.name: T:VscAppz.OutputChannelProperties
member.summary:
An output channel is a container for readonly textual information.
To get an instance of an `OutputChannel` use [createOutputChannel](#window.createOutputChannel).

member.name: F:VscAppz.OutputChannelProperties.Name
member.summary: The human-readable name of this output channel.
